intro: Seseli buchtormense, commonly known as the Buchtorfen seseli, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many familiar herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stem and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are typically finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
